Article Title: 'Vanished in minutes': Virat Kohli fever sells out Vizag ODI; Kaif's viral post captures crowd frenzy
Article Text:
Virat Kohli and Arshdeep Singh at Vizag. (Pic credit: BCCI)

NEW DELHI: Virat Kohli hasn’t just returned to form — he has set off a nationwide frenzy strong enough to sell out an entire stadium. Back-to-back centuries in Ranchi and Raipur have turned what was shaping up to be a low-interest ODI in Visakhapatnam into the hottest cricket ticket in India this week. According to officials at the Andhra Cricket Association (ACA), Kohli’s stunning run-scoring spree single-handedly reversed sluggish online bookings for the third ODI against South Africa at the Dr. Y.S. Rajasekhara Reddy ACA-VDCA Stadium.When tickets first went on sale digitally on November 28, the association braced for a disappointing turnout. The lack of buzz even pushed the ACA towards the rare option of setting up offline ticket counters despite committing to a fully digital system this time. But everything changed the moment Kohli unfurled a spectacular century in Ranchi on November 30. Suddenly, Phase 2 and 3 of ticket sales disappeared in minutes.“The first phase response wasn’t good,” confirmed Y. Venkatesh from ACA’s Media and Operations department to The Indian Express. “After Kohli’s hundred at Ranchi, the second and third phases vanished in minutes. Nothing was left unsold.”It wasn’t just victory that fans chased — it was the chance to witness a phenomenon.Kohli’s numbers in Vizag fuelled the madness: an average of 97.83 in seven ODIs, featuring three centuries and a 99. Even ticket prices ranging from Rs 1,200 to Rs 18,000 couldn’t slow demand.The frenzy spilled into real life, too. Hours before Team India landed in Vizag, hundreds gathered at the airport, waiting through repeated flight delays from Raipur. Security guards were bombarded with one question in multiple languages: “When are they landing?” The answer mattered because Kohli was on board.After his 53rd ODI century in Raipur, cricket legends poured in praise. But the loudest came from Mohammad Kaif, who summed up a nation’s emotion in eight simple words: “Without Kohli cricket is nothing… pure vintage!”
Article Summary: Back-to-back centuries in Ranchi and Raipur have turned what was shaping up to be a low-interest ODI in Visakhapatnam into the hottest cricket ticket in India this week. According to officials at the Andhra Cricket Association, Kohli’s stunning run-scoring spree single-handedly reversed sluggish online bookings for the third ODI.

Article Title: 'Blinded Pakistan air's defences': IAF recalls day 3 of 1971 war; shares rare images
Article Text:
Image posted by @IAF_MCC

The Battle Pakistan Lost To India Days Before 1971 War | I Witness

NEW DELHI: The Indian Air Force (IAF) on Thursday marked the historic air operations carried out on December 5, the third day of the 1971 war, underscoring how air power proved decisive in shaping the conflict’s outcome and paving the way for India’s victory and the creation of Bangladesh.In a post on X, the IAF recalled its strike on the Sakesar radar station, which crippled Pakistan’s key western air defences for two days.“On the third day of the 1971 war, the IAF was everywhere the enemy looked — and many places where they didn’t expect. Hunters tore through Drigh Road and Karachi, smashing storage hangars. Canberras kept up relentless pressure, delivering 1,44,000 lbs of ordnance across four major airfields,” the post said.The IAF added that 132 missions were flown on the western front, with An-12s and Canberras “raining devastation on enemy concentrations.” On the eastern front, with the Pakistan Air Force effectively grounded, 104 offensive sorties by the IAF cleared the way for the Indian Army’s rapid march into East Pakistan, ultimately leading to the birth of Bangladesh.It also recalled the legendary Battle of Longewala, fought from December 4 to 7, 1971, in Rajasthan’s Longewala sector, where heavily outnumbered Indian troops held their ground against a major Pakistani assault — a defence in which the IAF also played a crucial role.“Four Hunters rewrote history — shattering an enemy armoured thrust and leaving 27 tanks destroyed and 10 more damaged. Jaisalmer stood safe because air power arrived when it mattered,” the post highlighted.The 1971 India–Pakistan war began on December 3 with Pakistan launching pre-emptive strikes on Indian air bases amid the Bangladesh Liberation War in East Pakistan. The conflict ended on December 16 with Pakistan’s defeat, the surrender of 93,000 troops — the largest military capitulation since World War II — and the emergence of Bangladesh as an independent nation.
Article Summary: The Indian Air Force (IAF) on Thursday marked the historic air operations carried out on December 5, the third day of the 1971 war. The IAF recalled its strike on the Sakesar radar station, which crippled Pakistan’s key western air defences for two days.

Article Title: Pregnant Sunali brought back to India with son
Article Text:
Sunali

was unwell & crying... I’m worried, says her mother

KOLKATA: Birbhum resident Sunali Khatun, nine months and 12 days pregnant, returned to India along with her son, Shabir, 8, on Friday evening, six months after the family’s ordeal began with Delhi Police detaining them as “illegal immigrants”, BSF pushing them into Bangladesh, and authorities there jailing them for illegal entry.Mother and son entered Bengal through the Mahadipur border checkpoint in Malda around 7pm and were received by zilla parishad sabhadhipati Lipika Ghosh and other Trinamool functionaries. Officials took them to Malda Medical College and Hospital, where doctors ran tests to decide when she can travel four-and-a-half hours by road to reach her home in Birbhum.Bangladeshi couple Farooq and Mumtaj Hossain, who hosted Sunali Khatun and her family after they received bail a few days ago, said doctors in Chapai Nawabganj had planned to induce labour. They abandoned the plan when Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) said she needed to be handed over to BSF immediately. Sunali’s husband Danish Sk remains in Bangladesh, awaiting completion of repatriation formalities along with fellow Birbhum resident Sweety Biwi & her two sons.All six were deported on June 26 despite having Aadhaar and other identity documents, their lawyers said. Sunali, Danish and Sweety had been earning a living as ragpickers in Delhi when they were rounded up on June 17 on suspicion of being Bangladeshis living illegally in India.With 26-year-old Sunali’s repatriation getting delayed despite Supreme Court’s Dec 3 directive to govt to ensure her return “during the course of the day”, her counsel had mailed the court’s registry early Friday for an urgent hearing by the bench of CJI Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi.Things began to move around 3.30pm after a BGB team and Indian embassy officials reached Chapai Nawabganj to escort Sunali and her child from the house where they were being kept, till the international border. Rampurhat chief medical officer Sovan De said all possible medical arrangements were made for Sunali’s arrival in Birbhum. Social worker Mofijul Sk, who was in Bangladesh to facilitate her return, said an ambulance would take her from Malda to her home once doctors certified her fit to travel.Sunali’s mother Jyotsna and her daughter Anisha returned to their Birbhum home from Delhi on Friday. Both had travelled to the national capital for the SC hearing on Dec 3. “We boarded a train from Delhi as soon as we were told Sunali was coming back. I am worried about her health. She was feeling unwell and crying when I spoke to her at noon,” Jyotsna said. West Bengal Migrant Welfare Board chairperson Samirul Islam, who led the legal battle for Sunali’s repatriation, wrote on X that her return would be remembered as “a historic moment that exposes the torture and atrocities inflicted on poor Bengalis”.(With inputs from Subhro Maitra in Malda and S Boral in Suri)
Article Summary: Sunali Khatun, nine months and 12 days pregnant, returned to India along with her son, Shabir, 8, on Friday evening. Doctors ran tests to decide when she can travel four-and-a-half hours by road to reach her home in Birbhum. Sunali’s husband Danish Sk remains in Bangladesh, awaiting completion of repatriation formalities.

Article Title: IndiGo fiasco: Grounded by chaos, couple joins own reception online
Article Text:
Bengaluru Newlyweds Attend Reception Online After Indigo Cancellations Derail Travel Plans

Hubballi/Bhubaneswar: Boarding off, marriage event still on. A software engineer couple who got hitched recently in Bhubaneswar appeared online for their wedding reception in the bride's Karnataka hometown Hubballi after their IndiGo flight's last-minute cancellation left them stranded in the Odisha capital.With the reception hall booked in Hubballi, families gathered, and rituals scheduled, the guests took their seats at the venue. The only persons missing were newlyweds Sangam Das and Medha Ksheerasagar.The couple finally showed up - via video link from Bhubaneswar. They went through the motions on screen in all their wedding finery, completing the event. Medha's parents sat in the chairs meant for the couple at the venue - a standout moment that stayed with the guests and became another face of the IndiGo fiasco.Bhubaneswar's Sangam and Medha, who work in Bengaluru, got married on Nov 23 and had a grand reception lined up in Hubballi.The couple had taken tickets from Bhubaneswar to Bengaluru and onward to Hubballi for Dec 2. Tickets for several relatives were also booked for the same day.Then the trouble started. Family members said IndiGo staff kept telling them the flight was "delayed", beginning 9am on Dec 2 and continuing late into the night.Finally, on the morning of Dec 3 - just hours before the reception - the airline informed the passengers that the flight had been cancelled.With no alternative travel arrangement possible at such short notice, the bride and groom got stuck in Bhubaneswar. "...If IndiGo had informed us earlier, we could have made other arrangements. Because they did not provide timely information, the reception had to be held online," Medha's father Anil Kumar told TOI.The couple apologised to the guests with folded hands for not being able to attend the reception in Hubballi in person and thanked them profusely for making the best of the moment despite the disruption.Medha's father stressed the reception could have proceeded as planned had the airline acted in time. "Because they didn't provide proper information, we had no option," Kumar said.
Article Summary: Bhubaneswar's Sangam and Medha Ksheerasagar got married on Nov 23. The couple had a grand reception lined up in Hubballi, Karnataka. IndiGo staff kept telling them the flight was "delayed", beginning 9am on Dec 2 and continuing late into the night.

Article Title: Wife’s suicide threats amount to mental cruelty: HC
Article Text:
Representative image

RAIPUR: The Chhattisgarh high court has observed that a woman’s repeated threats of dying by suicide amounts to mental cruelty towards her husband. Also, attempts at ‘self-harm’ and persistent pressure on the husband to convert his religion, too, amounted to mental cruelty, the court noted.A division bench of Justices Rajani Dubey and Amitendra Kishore Prasad on Thursday made the observations while upholding a family court order that granted divorce to a resident of Balod district in Chhattisgarh. The wife had challenged the June 2024 order.The bench stressed that cruelty isn’t physical alone and can include “conduct causing reasonable apprehension in the petitioner’s mind.”The court noted that the husband had lodged a written complaint with Gurur police station in Balod district on Oct 14, 2019, reporting multiple suicide threats by his wife — including attempts to consume poison, stab herself with knife and set herself ablaze by pouring kerosene. He stated that he lived in constant fear. They were married in May 2018.The bench recorded that in cross-examination, the husband admitted he had left his wife at her parental home because he feared she may harm herself. “The wife’s repeated suicide attempts and threats created a situation of sustained mental harassment for the husband,” the court observed, adding that such conduct “satisfies the legal test of cruelty”.The HC took note of a testimony from a community representative who stated that the wife and her family pressed the husband to adopt Islam, an allegation the appellant denied.The bench found the parties had been living separately since Nov 2019 and the wife did not return despite multiple attempts by the husband and village elders. While the wife argued she always wished to resume cohabitation and the husband sought divorce only after she filed cases under Section 125 CrPC and the Domestic Violence Act, the court held that the overall evidence showed she had deserted him without just cause.
Article Summary: The Chhattisgarh high court observed that a woman’s repeated threats of dying by suicide amounts to mental cruelty towards her husband. A division bench of Justices Rajani Dubey and Amitendra Kishore Prasad on Thursday made the observations while upholding a family court order. The wife had challenged the June 2024 order.

What a Reunion Would Mean for the Warriors

Themay be eyeing a reunion that would a fan-favorite veteran ahead of the trade deadline. With the franchise looking to sharpen its three-point firepower for the rest of the season, recent speculation suggests the team could target a familiar face: Dallas Mavericks guard Klay Thompson, a four-time NBA champion currently on a $50 million deal.The discussion gained traction after Blue Man Hoop’s Nick San Miguel suggested that Dallas, now in organizational transition, could move on from some of its higher-priced veterans. As Miguel wrote, “With the Mavericks in a state of flux after firing general manager Nico Harrison, it would not be surprising if they traded away some of their pricier players like (Klay) Thompson or Anthony Davis.”Golden State’s intentions have been clear from the moment they signed Seth Curry on Monday. A franchise built on outside shooting needs more consistency from deep, and Curry’s arrival already looks promising.In his first game with the Warriors, the 35-year-old guard delivered 14 points while shooting an impressive 85.7 percent from the field and 66.7 percent from three against the Oklahoma City Thunder. Still, the front office appears to be exploring additional depth options.The Golden State Warriors have rotated through several shooting guards this season, hoping someone would seize the role.Here’s how the current situation stands:Nick San Miguel emphasized this instability, noting, “Golden State has cycled through the shooting guard position this season.” That context opens the door to the possibility of bringing back Thompson, a move that would be both sentimental and strategic. (H/t: Sporting News)Dallas Mavericks’ front office changes have created uncertainty around the roster. Klay Thompson, now 6-foot-5 and 21 games into the season, has delivered a mix of high-ceiling performances and off nights that have raised questions about his consistency.His performances have ranged widely, with games where he “set the nets on fire” and others where he “looked washed-up in every aspect of the game.” That unpredictability makes him a gamble=, but one the Warriors may feel is worthwhile.Bringing Klay Thompson back would tap into a decade of history. The Golden State Warriors’ four championships with Stephen Curry all came with Thompson by his side. While his current form is less reliable, the franchise might view the reunion as a chance to recapture some of that magic as Curry’s career winds down.• Familiarity with Steve Kerr’s system• Deep playoff experience• Ability to stretch the floor• Potential second-unit scoring sparkEven with concerns about consistency, Thompson’s long-range resume remains elite. If he can rediscover rhythm in a familiar environment, he could become a valuable contributor for a team still chasing another title in the Curry era.If Golden State does pursue a trade, expectations would need to be tempered. Thompson is no longer the 20-point scorer he once was, but his shooting gravity and veteran presence could elevate a second unit that has lacked stability.The move would also carry emotional weight. For fans, players, and even the organization, welcoming Thompson back would feel like closing a circle—one more run with a core that defined an era of NBA basketball.Also read: NBA trade rumors: Los Angeles Lakers predicted to land $186 million Milwaukee Bucks superstar to form Big 3 with LeBron James and Luka Doncic As of now, it remains speculation, but the idea is no longer far-fetched. The Warriors want shooting, the Mavericks may be recalibrating, and Thompson sits right at the intersection of both storylines. Whether nostalgia or strategy ultimately drives the decision, Golden State could find itself revisiting one of the most iconic partnerships in franchise history.
Article Summary: The Golden State Warriors have rotated through several shooting guards this season. The wife of LA Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford has found her own way to rebound from Sunday’s exhausting Week 13 loss. Kelly Stafford skipped the gloomy weather and the sting of the Rams’ 31–28 defeat and headed straight to Mexico, where sunshine, warm water and good friends offered the perfect escape. She shared on Instagram that she has been in Cabo celebrating the 40th birthday of her close friend Jess Clausen, the wife of former NFL quarterback Jimmy Clausen. The trip has turned into a cheerful break filled with laughter, ocean views and a reminder that life moves forward.Kelly posted a carousel of photos showing the group relaxing on a boat, taking fishing trips, enjoying long beachside meals and even squeezing in a friendly tennis match. The podcaster looked confident and carefree in a bikini, soaking in the moment far from the rain-soaked stadium in Charlotte, where she had watched the Rams fall short after Matthew Stafford’s late fourth-quarter fumble. She had also been busy that night searching for the football from her husband’s record-breaking pass, which teammate Davante Adams had unknowingly given away.Matthew Stafford’s wife, Kelly, uploaded a series of sunny photos from the celebration in Los Cabos.She wore a green bikini as the centerpiece of her look, pairing it with soft layers and warm colors that highlighted the playful feel of the trip. The top carried a bright geometric print with emerald, lime and turquoise woven together. The matching bottoms had slim side ties resting high on her hips. She added a moss green wrap loosely knotted at her waist that showed off her toned midriff.Her accessories stayed simple. Kelly wore sleek black oval sunglasses, and in some photos, she added a silk bandana in warm oranges and pinks. The relaxed styling matched the tone of her caption, where she wrote, “Celebrating you is easy @jessclausen,” and added, “Happy birthday to one of my best friends, may this be the best decade yet ❤️❤️❤️.”Matthew Stafford, meanwhile, has already shifted gears. He said getting over losses “just feels like it comes easy to me” and reminded reporters that another game always waits. The Rams head next to State Farm Stadium for a division showdown with the Cardinals, and Kelly seems to be carrying that same forward-looking spirit.Also Read: Kylie Kelce reveals how Jason’s endless patience keeps their home calm amid four daughters’ nonstop “why” questions

NEW DELHI: Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana has broken her social media silence with her first post since her wedding postponement. And now that her engagement ring is missing from the videoWatch:Shravan Mandhana, Smriti's brother, has denied rumours about a new wedding date, confirming that the postponement remains in effect with no new date set.Both families have requested privacy during this challenging period. Palash's sister has publicly acknowledged the strain on both families.In a show of support, teammate Jemimah Rodrigues opted to skip the Women's Big Bash League to remain in India with Mandhana.Mandhana is set to return to cricket in a five-match T20I series against Sri Lanka from December 21 to 30. Goaltender Joseph Woll of the Toronto Maple Leafs skates during a stoppage in play during the first period of a game against the Carolina Hurricanes (Credit: Getty Images)

Joseph Woll’s injury's impact on Maple Leafs at Hurricanes game



The Toronto Maple Leafs faced another difficult night as goaltender Joseph Woll exited their NHL match today against the Carolina Hurricanes after two periods due to a lower-body injury. The timing could not be worse for the team, especially considering their struggles in the NHL standings and the ongoing pressure to regain stability in the Atlantic Division.Woll’s departure came without much warning, and head coach Craig Berube offered no detailed update postgame. By stating only that the team is still evaluating the extent of the injury. Fans are worried because of this lack of clarity. Especially given Woll’s importance in recent games. Also, in his role in keeping the Maple Leafs competitive. Despite defensive inconsistencies.Backup goaltender Dennis Hildeby was thrust into action for the third period, stepping in admirably to help secure a hard-fought performance against the Hurricanes. While Hildeby managed the situation well, the reality remains that the Maple Leafs are now without both Joseph Woll and Anthony Stolarz, who has already been sidelined due to injury.With two key netminders out, Toronto’s depth will be tested heavily as they attempt to stay afloat.This situation also raises questions about potential NHL trade rumors. As the Maple Leafs may be forced to explore emergency backup options or short-term moves. All depending on how long Woll and Stolarz remain unavailable.The injury concerns overshadow what was otherwise an important outing for the Maple Leafs, who continue searching for consistency. With their goaltending core depleted, every upcoming NHL match preview will revolve around who gets the nod in net and whether the team can remain competitive under the circumstances.For now, Toronto can only hope that Woll’s injury is not long-term; because without him and Stolarz, the road ahead becomes significantly more challenging.Also Read: NHL Update: Brad Marchand and his family hosts Thanksgiving to comfort teammates missing home
Article Summary: Goaltender Joseph Woll left the game after two periods due to a lower-body injury. Head coach Craig Berube offered no detailed update on the extent of the injury. Backup goaltender Dennis Hildeby was thrust into action for the third period, stepping in admirably.

Article Title: MLB insider points Red Sox toward Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber as game-changing power targets
Article Text:
MLB insider points Red Sox toward Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber as game-changing power targets (Image Via Getty)

Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber seen as Boston’s strongest chance to upgrade the offense

Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber are now the two main power hitters the Boston Red Sox are looking at for this offseason. This comes after the Red Sox were knocked out by the New York Yankees in the postseason last month in New York. The team wants strong bats, and these two names are seen as the best way to fix the middle of the order, according to The Athletic reporter Jen McCaffrey, who wrote this in a detailed report published in late November 2025.Boston already added Sonny Gray and Johan Oviedo to help the pitching staff, but the club still needs a hitter who can bring steady power every day. The Red Sox lost Rafael Devers before last season in a trade, and Alex Bregman chose free agency this month. Because of that, the front office believes a strong hitter in the heart of the lineup is now the top need.Jen McCaffrey wrote that Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber “represent the best opportunity to upgrade the offense,” and the Red Sox front office agrees with that view.Alonso, who played first base for the New York Mets last season, is known for long home runs and steady run production.He becomes one of the top power bats on the market this winter.Published during the last week of November 2025, just before the start of the winter meetings, the report was made public.Having played for the Philadelphia Phillies in 2025, Kyle Schwarber hit 56 home runs last year. He is free to sign a long-term contract having earlier this month rejected the Phillies' qualifying offer in Philadelphia.Many MLB insiders predict he will sign a roughly five-year, $145 million deal.Having played in Boston in years past as well, Schwarber knows Fenway Park and how hitters adapt to the wall in left field.At the GM meetings this month, Red Sox chief baseball officer Craig Breslow told journalists and verified that the team is striving for a potent middle-order bat.Breslow said, “Someone who is a threat who can hit in the middle of the order and can lengthen our lineup is something we want to pursue.”His comments came during his on-record session with reporters, held at the annual meetings in Arizona earlier this month.These moves matter because Boston needs instant power. Both Alonso and Schwarber can change a game with one swing.If the Red Sox land even one of them, the lineup becomes much harder to pitch to, especially in tight games or late innings.Also Read: MLB Trade Rumors: Toronto Blue Jays Eying Kyle Tucker This Week As Pete Alonso Becomes A Key Red Sox Move
Article Summary: Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber seen as Boston’s strongest chance to upgrade the offense. This comes after the Red Sox were knocked out by the New York Yankees in the postseason last month in New York. The team wants strong bats, and these two names are seen as the best way to fix the middle of the order.

Article Title: Khamzat Chimaev reaches out to $17.1 billion entrepreneur Pavel Durov with a corner request for his next fight
Article Text:
Khamzat Chimaev reaches out to $17.1 billion entrepreneur Pavel Durov with a corner request for his next fight (Image Via Getty)

Khamzat Chimaev, Pavel Durov and what comes next for ‘Borz’

Khamzat Chimaev posted on X this week asking Telegram founder Pavel Durov to be in his corner for his next fight. The message came while Chimaev is off the fight list for a foot surgery and a planned recovery that will stretch into and after Ramadan 2026.Khamzat Chimaev said he wants a big name with him when he steps back into the Octagon. The post read in part, “Brother @durov in my corner next …” and the invite quickly made headlines across MMA sites and social feeds. Promoters and media now watch to see if Durov, the billionaire Telegram CEO will accept.Khamzat Chimaev is injured and will have a small operation on his foot, sources say. He told reporters he will pause full training until after Ramadan.That timing means he likely will not fight until late March or April 2026, depending on recovery. While he heals, Chimaev has named Nassourdine Imavov as a possible next challenger and has also answered calls for a superfight with Alex Pereira.Chimaev’s public invite to Pavel Durov adds a new twist. Durov is a tech billionaire (listed at about $17.1 billion by some outlets) and he has recently worked with former fighters like Khabib Nurmagomedov on Telegram projects.Khabib sold digital papakha collectibles on Telegram and helped raise roughly $4–4.5 million in November 2025, showing how the platform can link fighters and rich backers. That history makes Durov a logical target for Chimaev’s request.There is also history between Chimaev and Team Khabib. The two sides had a near-brawl after UFC 280 in Abu Dhabi in October 2022 when Chimaev pushed Abubakar Nurmagomedov.Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov and Khabib later helped calm things down. Recently, Chimaev posted a message praising Islam Makhachev and showing he wants peace with the Dagestani group.That all makes a Durov cornering moment possible, since Khabib and Durov have worked together before.Chimaev’s X post and the reports appeared in late November to early December 2025.His surgery and plan to resume full training after Ramadan were reported during the same period by MMA outlets covering UFC offseason news.If recovery goes well, Khamzat Chimaev’s comeback fight could happen in spring or early summer 2026.Also Read: Joe Rogan Claims Jesus May Come Back As Artificial Intelligence And Sends Social Media Into Debate
Article Summary: Khamzat Chimaev is injured and will have a small operation on his foot. He told reporters he will pause full training until after Ramadan. That timing means he likely will not fight until late March or April 2026, depending on recovery.

Article Title: Shilo Sanders’ bankruptcy scandal intensifies: NFL star accused of hiding $250K in NIL earnings as attorney slams flawed claims
Article Text:
Shilo Sanders faces $250K NIL transfer dispute amid bankruptcy case (Image via: Getty Images)

Shilo Sanders’ NIL earnings and legal issues under review



Shilo Sanders’ NFL career and bankruptcy case raise questions about NIL earnings



Shilo Sanders, the NFL free agent and son of legendary coach Deion Sanders, is at the center of a growing financial and legal storm. The former Colorado safety, who recently filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy, is now accused of making unauthorized transfers totaling $250,000. The controversy revolves around money earned from his college football name, image, and likeness (NIL) deals, raising questions about compliance with bankruptcy law.The dispute has attracted significant media attention, as Sanders’ attorney strongly challenges the claims. Keri Riley, representing Sanders, insists the allegations are fundamentally flawed and argues that the funds in question were legitimately earned after the bankruptcy filing. According to Riley, the earnings, processed through companies created by Sanders, Big 21 LLC and Headache Gang LLC, should not be considered part of the bankruptcy estate.The trustee handling Sanders’ bankruptcy case claims the NFL player improperly transferred funds post-petition, potentially violating federal bankruptcy rules. These transfers, linked to Sanders’ NIL income during and after college, are now under legal review.Riley maintains that the money was generated legitimately and was separate from any pre-bankruptcy liabilities, emphasizing that Sanders’ NIL agreements are a modern revenue source increasingly used by college athletes.Adding complexity, Sanders faces a longstanding financial obligation stemming from a 2015 lawsuit. A former high school security guard in Dallas alleged Sanders caused injuries during an incident, and a default judgment of nearly $12 million was awarded. While Sanders filed for bankruptcy to manage this liability, the current allegations over NIL transfers complicate his path to financial resolution.Despite off-field challenges, Sanders briefly joined the Tampa Bay Buccaneers as an undrafted free agent. Reports indicate he signed a three-year contract worth roughly $2.97 million, although he earned just $1,572 in guaranteed money after being released during the preseason. His professional prospects now remain uncertain, with both legal and career questions looming.As this case unfolds, it highlights the intersection of bankruptcy law and modern NIL earnings, an emerging issue for athletes navigating financial and legal obligations. With Sanders’ attorney disputing the trustee’s claims, the outcome could set an important precedent for how post-bankruptcy NIL income is treated in the future.Also Read: “Never seen a call like that”: Dak Prescott slams referees after controversial penalty in Lions’ 44-30 win over Cowboys
Article Summary: NFL free agent Shilo Sanders faces $250K NIL transfer dispute amid bankruptcy case. Former Colorado safety accused of making unauthorized transfers totaling $250,000. Controversy revolves around money earned from his college football name, image, and likeness (NIL) deals.
